title: What would happen if in WWII Edward VIII refused to step down? - Quora

response.answer_text: Short of ending the monarchy entirely, the normal step to deal with a king who was regarded as unfit or unready would be to appoint a regent or regency council to perform his duties and make his decisions in his place. He’d still be King but with no budget, no authority, he’d pretty much be SOL. However, it is not clear if there was a regency act in effect in Edward’s time. He’d have to sign a new one for it to become law and what if he refused?

He had no choice, the soveriegn riegns as long as Parliament wishes He was offered a choice between the throne OR Mrs Spencer - not both His right wing tendencies were shared by many in the aristocracy in the early years of Hitlers power but that support waned significanlty as war grew near Had he chosen the throne then if he peristed in displaying nazi sympathies he would either have been effectively isolated and denied a public voice or removed by Parliament

I’m not quite sure what you mean by this question. Edward VIII abdicated in December 1936. WWII didn’t begin until 1939. So he couldn’t have “refused to step down in WWII”. He was already long gone, and his brother crowned King, by then.
Nothing. He was a constitutional monarch, like his niece the Queen is now. It would have complicated things, but then he like the Queen acted on the advice of his ministers.
He abdicated in 1936 three years before WWII. His brother assumed the throne as George VI and he was a stalwart refusing to leave London. I somehow doubt Edward would have done the same thing.

He would have been prosecuted for treason. British intelligence had proof that he was conspiring with the Nazis to launch a fascist coup that would make him dictator and then he would ally Britain with Germany.
